items.title: Cape Smokey ‚Äì Ingonish, Nova Scotia
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Cape Smokey ski hill in Cape Breton is upgrading its power systems from the mid-point to the top of the hill to meet growing energy needs, make more snow, and phase out diesel for cleaner air and less noise. 

Transcription
Cape Smokey is making more snow and more tourism opportunities with more efficient energy. New, modern power systems at the ski hill will help meet energy and snowmaking needs while replacing diesel, for cleaner air and less noise. 
Investing in clean growth pays off:  new markets, more jobs, accelerated growth, while minimizing environmental impacts.  
SMEs like Cape Smokey are leading the way by adopting new technologies and approaches to doing business.</article>

items.title: Bear River First Nation, N.S.
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content: <article>We‚Äôre grateful for projects that connect us to the earth and one another. Bear River First Nation, #Mikmaki is embracing those connections to drive economic development.</article>

items.title: Town of Salisbury‚Äôs new amphitheatre - NB
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Salisbury will soon host a variety of events, bringing people together in their new, vibrant community space. From concerts to community gatherings, the Salisbury amphitheatre is set to become a cornerstone of local entertainment and engagement. Plus, with the addition of a new trail system for walking and biking, there's even more to explore and enjoy. #gc 

Transcript:
So, we've had this dream for many, many years. But of course, it takes funding to do these types of things. 
And as a small community, we don't always have the resources to make these things happen. 
So obviously when we approached ACOA with the idea and the relevance as well as the opportunities and the benefits for our community ACOA came forward obviously with funding.
The importance of the amphitheater as well as the connecting trail to our residents is something that they've been asking for for many, many years.
As Canada's most active community in 2023, we show that having a very connected community is important where people can walk trails and do recreational activities.
The amphitheater was one of those where we could bring people together in our community, connecting place where we can grow as one. And we're just so thrilled to have this happening in our community.</article>

items.title: BioAccelerator Groundbreaking - PEI
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Congratulations to the PEI BioAlliance on the official groundbreaking of the BioAccelerator! üî¨üß™üß¨ 

Learn more about the new facility that is propelling the region‚Äôs bioscience cluster forward: https://peibioalliance.com/news/government-industry-partnership-breaks-ground-on-50-million-bioaccelerator/

Transcript
BIOACCELERATOR GROUNDBREAKING

The P.E.I. BioAlliance has broken ground on the BioAccelerator, a 60,000 sq. ft. facility that will provide essential infrastructure for the region‚Äôs bioscience and life sciences industry.

Expected to be completed in 2026, the facility will be occupied by researchers, entrepreneurs, and bioscience-based companies.

PEI‚Äôs bioscience community is widely recognized for its collaborative economic cluster model that drives innovation and sector growth.

The sector now includes 60 bioscience companies earning over $600 million annually in sales, making bioscience the second-largest industry in P.E.I.

The PEI Bioscience Cluster has surpassed 2025 growth targets and is well on its way to becoming a billion-dollar industry by 2030.

ACOA is proud to support this major advancement in Prince Edward Island‚Äôs bioscience innovation ecosystem!</article>

items.title: The Fredericton Pickleball Club - New Brunswick
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>The Fredericton Pickleball Club is serving up community engagement and boosting the local economy with their accessible courts! #GC
Learn more about this organization and how ACOA made a difference: https://www.canada.ca/en/atlantic-canada-opportunities/campaigns/impacts/fredericton-pickleball.html</article>

items.title: Fall Food Tourism - PEI
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content: <article>Fall is the perfect time to showcase the best of Prince Edward Island through food and music. The region is capitalizing on its distinct strengths and offering authentic cultural experiences to build a sustainable tourism industry that feels welcoming to everyone.</article>

items.title: Port Charlottetown - PEI

items.content: <article>Congratulations to Port Charlottetown on another busy cruise ship season, bringing in an estimated 167,000 visitors to Prince Edward Island in 2024. üö¢üëã  #GC</article>

items.title: Stratford Waterfront Gathering and Event Space - PEI
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content: <article>The Town of Stratford recently announced the grand opening of the Stratford Waterfront Gathering and Event Space. This new infrastructure, supported through ACOA‚Äôs Innovative Communities Fund, is part of the community‚Äôs vision for a more inclusive, greener, and sustainable future.</article>

items.content: <article>Congratulations to the 17 Atlantic Canadian entrepreneurs who competed in Let‚Äôs Pitch It 2024 this month. Your ideas and ingenuity are a powerful force. You develop innovative products, deliver vital services, and drive economic growth all around you.</article>

NLOWE empowers women by helping them start, grow, and advance in business. Congratulations to the NLOWE team on another successful event!

items.title: Maritime Gourmet Mushrooms - Great Village, NS
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>We grow when we help others grow.
 
When Jason Giffin, President of Maritime Gourmet Mushrooms Inc., decided to move his business from Halifax to Great Village, NS, he discovered the #RuralAdvantage ‚Äì a supportive network of farms, restaurants and retail businesses that helped him establish his operation.

ACOA is part of that network, helping @MaritimeGourmet expand to a new, larger facility in Debert. Now, Maritime Gourmet Mushrooms can help others in return.</article>

items.title: Nova Scotia - World Tourism Day
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Winter hibernator or cold-weather adventurer: which one are you?
Whatever the answer, a winter wonderland awaits you in Ingonish, Nova Scotia.
 
Locals and visitors flock to the Cape Breton Highlands when the snow flies, and that‚Äôs why 4-season recreation and accommodation is growing in the region.</article>

items.title: Saltair Nordic Spa and Wellness - Canning, NS
items.author: ACOACanada
items.content:
<article>Saltair Nordic is helping to extend the tourism seasonin the Annapolis Valley!

With support from ACOA, owners June Pardy and Jenny Sinclair were able to act on an idea to combine yoga and the spa experience. Saltair Nordic Spa and Wellness provides a local hub for the community and attracts visitors to the area year-round.</article>
